definition: to only have
disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence
surname Tu
tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies

sentences.english: However, because of various reasons, the preparatory process is often a formality.
sentences.chinese: 然而由於種種原因，前置程序往往徒具形式。

sentences.english: The best way to get a bad law repealed is to enforce it strictly.
sentences.chinese: 廢除徒具空名的法律最好的方法就是嚴格地執行它。

sentences.english: The rubber-stamp legislature has not been consulted.
sentences.chinese: 徒具形式的立法機構不被諮詢。

sentences.english: It acknowledges the possibility of bad laws.
sentences.chinese: 它承認徒具空名的法律是可能存在的。

definition: looks impressive but is worthless (idiom)/not as good as it looks/a reputation with no substance
with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be
gilded exterior, shabby and ruined on the inside (idiom)
pinyin: jin1 yu4 qi2 wai4 , bai4 xu4 qi2 zhong1

definition: tantamount to/to be like
the name does not correspond to reality (idiom); it doesn't live up to its reputation
silvery spear point actually made of pewter (idiom); fig. worthless despite an attractive exterior
to rely on/to base oneself on
to go through the motions
cunning/dexterous/ingenious
to change (for the worse)
to use as a stopgap/to give perfunctory recognition/token/nominal
the human body/skeleton
not worth a penny/utterly worthless
imaginary reputation/empty fame
heresy
to be evident at a glance (idiom)
